name: Earth
description: The blue and living sphere home to all our wonders.
intro: Earth is the rocky, terrestial planet we call home, covered mostly in liquid water.
It sits as the third planet from the Sun and is the only planet we know that bears life.
Earth's hospitable temperature and mix of chemicals are what make life possible.
Welcome to planetarium! Take good care of Earth and watch as it grows into the magnificent world that it is today.

name: Saturn
description: A giant crowned with celestial rings of glory.
intro: Saturn is a gas giant and the sixth planet from our Sun made of hydrogen and helium.
Its famous ring system is made of countless chunks of ice and rock.
It hosts a multitude of moons such as Titan, a world with a thick atmosphere and liquid methane lakes.
Welcome to planetarium! Can you grow Saturn and sustain its beautiful system of rings?

name: Kepler-16b
description: A beast cradled by twins under a double sunset.
intro: Kepler-16b is a rare gas giant orbiting not one, but two stars.
If you stood under the planet's cloudy atmosphere, you could witness a dazzling double sunset and double sunrise!
The planet is named after NASA's Kepler spacecraft, which itself was named after the astronomer Johannes Kelper.
Welcome to planetarium! Care for this world under its twin suns and witness a unique but legendary solar dance.

name: CoRoT-7b
description: A rocky world of lava drifting with fury.
intro: CoRoT-7b is a rocky, terrestrial planet locked in a terrifyingly close orbit around its star.
Its surface is a hellscape of molten rock and lava, with temperatures hot enough to vaporize stone.
One side endlessly faces its star every day, while the other side is deadlocked in a cold, infinite night.
Welcome to planetarium! Can you tame this dual-sided planet and survive its fiery orbit?
